name: master-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: ultra-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 2×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: great-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: poke-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: safari-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

This item can only be used in the great marsh or kanto safari zone.

name: net-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon is water- or bug-type, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: dive-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon was encountered by surfing or fishing, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: nest-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of given by `(40 - level) / 10`, where `level` is the wild Pokémon's level, to a maximum of 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's level is higher than 30, this ball has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: repeat-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's species is marked as caught in the trainer's Pokédex, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: timer-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of 1.1× on the first turn of the battle and increases by 0.1× every turn, to a maximum of 4× on turn 30.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: luxury-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  Whenever the caught Pokémon's happiness increases, it increases by one extra point.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: premier-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: dusk-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If it's currently nighttime or the wild Pokémon was encountered while walking in a cave, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: heal-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  The caught Pokémon's HP is immediately restored, PP for all its moves is restored, and any status ailment is cured.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: quick-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 4× on the first turn of a battle, but 1× any other time.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: cherish-ball
description:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: red-shard
description:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a sunny day TM in the house midway along the southern section of sinnoh route 212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on sinnoh route 212, in snowpoint city, and in the survival area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a cheri berry, a leppa berry, and a pecha berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in violet city.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a persim berry, a pomeg berry, and a razz berry with the Juggler near the pal park entrance in fuchsia city.

name: super-repel
description:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 200 steps.

name: max-repel
description:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 250 steps.

name: escape-rope
description:
Used outside of battle
:   Transports the trainer to the last-entered dungeon entrance.  Cannot be used outside, in buildings, or in distortion world, sinnoh hall of origin 1, spear pillar, or turnback cave.

name: repel
description:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 100 steps.

name: sun-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a cottonee into whimsicott, a gloom into bellossom, a petilil into lilligant, or a sunkern into sunflora.

name: moon-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a clefairy into clefable, a jigglypuff into wigglytuff, a munna into musharna, a nidorina into nidoqueen, a nidorino into nidoking, or a skitty into delcatty.

name: fire-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eevee into flareon, a growlithe into arcanine, a pansear into simisear, or a vulpix into ninetales.

name: thunder-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eelektrik into eelektross, an eevee into jolteon, or a pikachu into raichu.

name: water-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eevee into vaporeon, a lombre into ludicolo, a panpour into simipour, a poliwhirl into poliwrath, a shellder into cloyster, or a staryu into starmie.

name: leaf-stone
description:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an exeggcute into exeggutor, a gloom into vileplume, a nuzleaf into shiftry, a pansage into simisage, or a weepinbell into victreebel.

name: honey
description:
Used outside of battle
:   Immediately triggers a wild Pokémon battle, as long as the trainer is somewhere with wild Pokémon—i.e., in tall grass, in a cave, or surfing.

Can be smeared on sweet-smelling trees to attract tree-dwelling Pokémon after six hours.

name: damp-mulch

name: stable-mulch

Used on a patch of soil

name: gooey-mulch
description:
Used on a path of soil
:   Plant will regrow after dying 25% more times.

name: grass-mail
description:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.

Held in battle

name: exp-share
description:
Held
:   Experience is split across two groups: Pokémon who participated in battle, and Pokémon holding this item.  Each Pokémon earns experience as though it had battled alone, divided by the number of Pokémon in its group, then divided by the number of groups. Pokémon holding this item who also participated in battle effectively earn experience twice.

    Fainted Pokémon never earn experience, and empty groups are
ignored; thus, if a single Pokémon is holding this item and the only Pokémon who battled faints from explosion, the holder will gain full experience.

name: quick-claw
description:
Held in battle
:   Whenever the holder attempts to use a move, it has a 3/16 chance to act first among moves with the same priority.  If multiple Pokémon have this effect at the same time, Speed is the tie-breaker as normal, but the effect of trick room is ignored.

name: choice-band

    The restriction ends even if this item is swapped for another Choice item
via trick or switcheroo.

name: kings-rock
description:
Held in battle
:   Holder's damaging moves have a 10% chance to make their target flinch.  This chance applies independently to each hit of a multi-hit move.

    This item's chance is rolled independently of any other move effects;
e.g., a move with a 30% chance to flinch normally will have a 37% total chance to flinch when used with this item, because 3% of the time, both effects activate.

Held by poliwhirl or slowbro
:   Holder evolves into politoed or slowking, respectively, when traded.

name: explorer-kit
description: Sends the trainer to the Underground.  Only usable outside.

name: loot-sack
description: Unused.

name: rule-book
description: Unused.

name: poke-radar
description: Designates several nearby patches of grass as containing Pokémon, some of which may be special radar-only Pokémon.  Successive uses in a certain way create chains of encounters with the same species; longer chains increase the chance that a shiny Pokémon of that species will appear.

name: point-card
description: Tracks Battle Points.

name: journal
description: Records some of the trainer's activities for the day.

name: seal-case
description: Contains Seals used for decorating Pokéballs.

name: fashion-case
description: Contains Pokémon Accessories.

name: seal-bag
description: Unused.

name: pal-pad
description: Contains friend codes for up to 32 other players, as well as their sprite, gender, and basic statistics for those that have been seen on WFC.

name: works-key
description: Opens the front door of the Valley Windworks.  Reusable.

name: old-charm
description: Given to Cynthia's grandmother to get the Surf HM.

name: galactic-key
description: Grants access to Galactic HQ in Veilstone City.

name: red-chain
description: Unused.

name: town-map
description: Displays a map of the region including the trainer's position, location names, visited towns, gym locations, and where the trainer has been walking recently.

name: vs-seeker
description: Reveals trainers who want a rematch, by showing !! over their heads.  Each use drains the battery; requires 100 steps to charge.

name: coin-case
description: Contains the Coins used by the Game Corner, to a maximum of 50,000.

name: old-rod
description: Used to find Pokémon on the Old Rod list for an area, which are generally Magikarp or similar.

name: good-rod
description: Used to find Pokémon on the Good Rod list for an area, which are generally mediocre.

name: super-rod
description: Used to find Pokémon on the Super Rod list for an area, which are generally the best available there.

name: sprayduck
description: Waters Berry plants.

name: poffin-case
description: Contains up to 100 Poffins.

name: bicycle
description: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  In high gear, allows the trainer to hop over some rocks and ascend muddy slopes.

name: suite-key
description: Opens the locked building in the lakeside resort.

name: oaks-letter
description: Grants access to Flower Paradise and Shaymin.

name: lunar-wing
description: Cures the sailor's son of his nightmares; no reward, only a side effect of seeing Cresselia.

name: member-card
description: Provides access to Newmoon Island and Darkrai.

name: ss-ticket
description:
Allows passage on a ferry.

The same item is used for different ferries between different games.

name: contest-pass
description: Allows the trainer to enter Contests.

name: magma-stone
description:
Causes Heatran to appear at Reversal Mountain.

Unused prior to Black and White 2.

name: parcel
description: Given to the trainer's rival in Jubilife City.  Contains two Town Maps, one of which is given to the trainer upon delivery.

name: coupon-1
description: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: coupon-2
description: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: coupon-3
description: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: storage-key
description: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.

name: secret-potion
description: Required to cure the Psyducks blocking Route 210 of their chronic headaches.

name: griseous-orb
description:
Held by giratina
:   Holder's dragon and ghost moves have 1.2× their base power.

    Holder is in Origin Forme.

This item cannot be held by any Pokémon but Giratina.  When you enter the Union Room or connect to Wi-Fi, this item returns to your bag.

name: vs-recorder
description:
Optionally records wireless, Wi-Fi, and Battle Frontier battles.

Tracks Battle Points earned in the Battle Frontier, and stores commemorative prints.

name: gracidea
description:
Used by trainer on a shaymin
:   Changes the target Shaymin from Land Forme to Sky Forme.

    This item cannot be used on a frozen Shaymin or at night.  Sky Forme Shaymin will revert to Land Forme overnight, when frozen, and upon entering a link battle.  This item must be used again to change it back.

name: secret-key
description:
Used by trainer in the Galactic Eterna Building, on the ground floor, to the left of the TV
:   Unlocks the secret rotom room, in which there are five appliances which can change Rotom's form.

name: apricorn-box
description: Stores Apricorns.

name: berry-pots
description: Contains four portable pots of soil suitable for growing berries.

name: squirt-bottle
description:
Required to water berries within the berry pots.

Required to battle the sudowoodo on johto route 36.

This item cannot be directly used from the bag.

name: lure-ball
description:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon was encountered by fishing, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 3× normal.

name: level-ball
description:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon's level is higher than:

    * four times the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.
    * than twice the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 4× normal.
    * the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 2× normal.

name: moon-ball
description:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon is a clefairy, nidoran m, nidoran f, jigglypuff, skitty, or any evolution thereof, the wild Pokémon has 4× its catch rate.

name: heavy-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon weighs:

    * 409.6 kg (903.0 lb) or more, its catch rate is 40 more than normal.
    * 307.2 kg (677.3 lb) or more, its catch rate is 30 more than normal.
    * 204.8 kg (451.5 lb) or more, its catch rate is 20 more than normal.
    * less than 204.8 kg (451.5 lb), its catch rate is 20 less than normal.

name: fast-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

:   If the wild Pokémon's base speed is 100 or more, its catch rate is 4× normal.

name: friend-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If caught, the wild Pokémon's happiness starts at 200.

name: love-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon and wild Pokémon are of the same species but opposite genders, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.

name: park-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon.

This item can only be used in pal park.

name: sport-ball
description:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.

    The wild Pokémon's catch rate is 1.5× normal.

name: red-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a level ball.

name: blue-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a lure ball.

name: yellow-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a moon ball.

name: green-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a friend ball.

name: pink-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a love ball.

name: white-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a fast ball.

name: black-apricorn
description: May be given to Kurt in azalea town to produce a heavy ball.

name: dowsing-machine
description:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Searches for hidden items.

name: rage-candy-bar
description: May be traded for a tm64 in the vertical Underground Path.

name: red-orb
description: Causes groudon to appear in the embedded tower.

name: blue-orb
description: Causes kyogre to appear in the embedded tower.

name: jade-orb
description: Causes rayquaza to appear in the embedded tower.

name: enigma-stone
description:
When taken to the pewter city museum, causes latias or latios to attack the trainer.

The Pokémon to appear will be whicher can't be encountered roaming in the wild.

name: unown-report
description: Lists which unown forms the trainer has caught.

name: blue-card
description: Allows the trainer to answer the daily question on Buena's radio show.  Records the points earned for correct answers.

name: slowpoke-tail
description: Does nothing.

name: clear-bell
description: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon ho oh to the top of the bell tower.

name: card-key
description:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens doors in the goldenrod city Radio Tower.

name: basement-key
description:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens the door to the basement tunnel under goldenrod city.

name: red-scale
description: May be traded to Mr. Pokémon for an exp share.

name: lost-item
description: May be traded to the Copycat for a pass.

name: pass
description: Allows the trainer to ride the Magnet Train between goldenrod city and saffron city.

name: machine-part
description: Must be replaced in the power plant to power the Magnet Train.

name: silver-wing
description: Causes lugia to appear in the whirl islands.

name: rainbow-wing
description: Causes ho oh to appear at the top of bell tower.

name: mystery-egg
description: Must be obtained to trigger the break-in at Professor Elm's lab, the first rival battle, and access to johto route 31.

name: gb-sounds
description:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Changes the background music to the equivalent 8-bit music.

name: tidal-bell
description: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon lugia to the top of the bell tower.

name: data-card-01
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-02
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-03
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have dashed in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-04
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have jumped in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-05
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Hurdle Dash.

name: data-card-06
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Relay Run.

name: data-card-07
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Pennant Capture.

name: data-card-08
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Block Smash.

name: data-card-09
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Disc Catch.

name: data-card-10
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Snow Throw.

name: data-card-11
description: Records the number of points the trainer has earned in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-12
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have messed up in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-13
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have defeated themselves in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-14
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have tackled in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-15
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have fallen in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-16
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Ring Drop.

name: data-card-17
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Lamp Jump.

name: data-card-18
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Circle Push.

name: data-card-19
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon over wirelss.

name: data-card-20
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon over wireless.

name: data-card-21
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first across all Pokéathlon events.

name: data-card-22
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last across all Pokéathlon events.

name: data-card-23
description: Records the number of times the trainer has switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-24
description: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Goal Roll.

name: data-card-25
description: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon received prizes in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-26
description: Records the number of times the trainer has instructed Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

name: data-card-27
description: Records the total time spent in the Pokéathlon.

name: lock-capsule
description: Does nothing.

name: photo-album
description: Does nothing.

name: orange-mail
description:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.

name: mach-bike
description: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Faster than the acro bike.  Allows the trainer to ascend muddy slopes.

name: acro-bike
description: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Slower than the mach bike.  Can perform various tricks, allowing the trainer to reach certain special areas.

name: wailmer-pail
description: Waters Berry plants.

name: devon-goods
description: Contains a machine part to be delivered to Captain Stern.

name: soot-sack
description: Collects soot when walking through tall grass on hoenn route 113.

name: pokeblock-case
description: Stores Pokéblocks.

name: letter
description: Contains a letter to be delivered to Steven.

name: eon-ticket
description: Provides access to southern island and either latias or latios, whichever is not available roaming around Hoenn.

name: scanner
description: May be traded to Captain Stern for a deep sea tooth or a deep sea scale.

name: go-goggles
description: Allows the trainer to enter the desert on hoenn route 111.

name: meteorite
description:
RSE: May be traded to Professor Cozmo for tm27.

FRLG: A meteorite to be delivered to Lostelle's father.

name: rm-1-key
description: Unlocks room 1 on the abandoned ship.

name: rm-2-key
description: Unlocks room 2 on the abandoned ship.

name: rm-4-key
description: Unlocks room 4 on the abandoned ship.

name: rm-6-key
description: Unlocks room 6 on the abandoned ship.

name: devon-scope
description: Reveals invisble kecleon on the overworld.

name: oaks-parcel
description: A parcel to be delivered to Professor Oak for a Pokédex.

name: poke-flute
description: Wakes up sleeping Pokémon.  Required to wake up sleeping snorlax on the overworld.

name: bike-voucher
description: May be traded for a bicycle.

name: gold-teeth
description: The Safari Zone warden's teeth, to be returned to him for hm04.

name: lift-key
description: Operates the elevator in the Celadon Rocket Hideout.

name: silph-scope
description: Identifies ghosts in pokemon tower.

name: fame-checker
description: Records information on various famous people.

name: tm-case
description: Stores TMs and HMs.

name: berry-pouch
description: Stores Berries.

name: teachy-tv
description: Teaches beginning trainers basic information.

name: tri-pass
description: Provides access to the first three Sevii Islands.

name: rainbow-pass
description: Provides access to the Sevii Islands.

name: tea
description: Used to bribe the saffron city guards for entry to the city.

name: mysticticket
description: Provides access to Navel Rock, ho oh, and lugia.

name: auroraticket
description: Provides access to Birth Island and deoxys.

name: powder-jar
description: Holds Berry Powder from Berry Crushing.

name: ruby
description: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.

name: sapphire
description: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.
